Marketing Officer Job at Tyonex Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Tyonex Nigeria Limited is a group of registered companies, with operational bases throughout Nigeria and Corporate Head Offices in Lagos, Nigeria. Established in September 1997, Tyonex is a member of the Pharmaceutical Manufacturing and Marketing Companies in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketing Officer

Job Location: Alimosho, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are looking for a creative and ambitious fresh graduate with a strong social media presence or influencer experience to join our marketing team.
	The Marketing Officer will support campaigns, create engaging content, and help grow the company’s brand online.


Key Responsibilities
Content Creation & Social Media:


	Create engaging posts, videos, reels, and stories for social media platforms.
	Use personal or professional social media influence to promote the company’s products/services.
	Monitor trends and suggest creative ways to engage the audience.


Campaign Support:


	Assist in planning and executing marketing campaigns (digital, social media, and events).
	Collaborate with the marketing team to ensure timely delivery of content and campaigns.


Audience Engagement:


	Respond to comments, messages, and feedback to foster community engagement.
	Act as a brand ambassador online and offline.


Reporting & Analysis:


	Track social media performance and campaign effectiveness.
	Prepare simple reports and insights for the marketing team.


Qualifications & Skills


	Fresh graduate in Marketing, Communications, Business, or related field.
	Strong personal social media presence or experience as an influencer.
	Excellent creativity, communication, and writing skills.
	Basic knowledge of social media tools and content creation (photo/video editing).
	Enthusiastic, self-motivated, and willing to learn.


Key Competencies:


	Social media savvy with knowledge of current trends.
	Ability to create engaging and shareable content.
	Strong personal brand or following is a plus.
	Team player with a proactive attitude.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their updated CV to: tnlrecruitment01@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Project Manager",
  "description": "WIOCC is the leading player in the deployment of carrier-scale, future-proofed network infrastructure into Africa. We have the flexibility and scale to meet the ever-growing demand for reliable, high-speed capacity throughout Africa, driven by end consumers, enterprise users and the ecosystem that supports them. Our policy of continual investment in our network to create Africa&rsquo;s first, truly hyperscale network infrastructure means ongoing investment for growth, ensuring our readiness to meet the future data volume demands of end users throughout Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job type: Full-time (On-site)
Category:&nbsp;Projects
Reporting Line: Programme Manager

Job Objective


	The Project Manager is responsible for overseeing all aspects of project planning, implementation, and execution.
	This includes managing both individual projects and groups of related company projects in a coordinated manner.
	The role ensures that projects are aligned to deliver intended benefits and maintain effective control throughout the project lifecycle.


Key Duties &amp; Responsibilities
Project Management &amp; Execution:


	Lead and manage WIOCC&rsquo;s network infrastructure projects to ensure timely and successful completion.
	Oversee client orders from pre-sales solution design to final handover, ensuring high levels of client satisfaction.
	Develop and maintain project charters, project plans, risk registers, budgets, and lessons learned documentation.
	Monitor project delivery milestones to ensure alignment with client target timelines.


Stakeholder &amp; Client Engagement:


	Collaborate closely with account managers to understand client requirements and ensure project alignment.
	Serve as the primary point of contact for clients, providing regular and accurate project updates and reports.
	Manage relationships with internal teams, stakeholders, and WIOCC clients effectively.
	Ensure seamless handovers to internal teams, aligning with client specifications.


Cross-Functional Coordination:


	Lead virtual project teams consisting of Engineering, Operations, Legal, Procurement, Logistics, and Finance.
	Engage and manage third-party suppliers to ensure compliance with client specifications, service level agreements (SLAs), and quality standards.
	Address and mitigate project concerns, contractual challenges, and risks, escalating issues where necessary.


Process &amp; Performance Improvement:


	Actively participate in and promote the project gate review process.
	Oversee vendor and logistics management, ensuring timely delivery of materials and services.
	Ensure data accuracy within NetSuite and other project management tools.
	Serve as a deputy for the Programme Manager as required and contribute to ad-hoc reporting.
	Actively participate in process improvement and automation initiatives.


Minimum Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree (or equivalent; a master&rsquo;s degree is an added advantage) in a technical field or equivalent relevant experience.
	PMP, PRINCE2, or AGILE certification is a must-have.
	Proficient in Microsoft Project.

Project Manager Job at WIOCC Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        WIOCC is the leading player in the deployment of carrier-scale, future-proofed network infrastructure into Africa. We have the flexibility and scale to meet the ever-growing demand for reliable, high-speed capacity throughout Africa, driven by end consumers, enterprise users and the ecosystem that supports them. Our policy of continual investment in our network to create Africa’s first, truly hyperscale network infrastructure means ongoing investment for growth, ensuring our readiness to meet the future data volume demands of end users throughout Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Manager
     

            
    



Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time (On-site)
Category: Projects
Reporting Line: Programme Manager

Job Objective


	The Project Manager is responsible for overseeing all aspects of project planning, implementation, and execution.
	This includes managing both individual projects and groups of related company projects in a coordinated manner.
	The role ensures that projects are aligned to deliver intended benefits and maintain effective control throughout the project lifecycle.


Key Duties & Responsibilities
Project Management & Execution:


	Lead and manage WIOCC’s network infrastructure projects to ensure timely and successful completion.
	Oversee client orders from pre-sales solution design to final handover, ensuring high levels of client satisfaction.
	Develop and maintain project charters, project plans, risk registers, budgets, and lessons learned documentation.
	Monitor project delivery milestones to ensure alignment with client target timelines.


Stakeholder & Client Engagement:


	Collaborate closely with account managers to understand client requirements and ensure project alignment.
	Serve as the primary point of contact for clients, providing regular and accurate project updates and reports.
	Manage relationships with internal teams, stakeholders, and WIOCC clients effectively.
	Ensure seamless handovers to internal teams, aligning with client specifications.


Cross-Functional Coordination:


	Lead virtual project teams consisting of Engineering, Operations, Legal, Procurement, Logistics, and Finance.
	Engage and manage third-party suppliers to ensure compliance with client specifications, service level agreements (SLAs), and quality standards.
	Address and mitigate project concerns, contractual challenges, and risks, escalating issues where necessary.


Process & Performance Improvement:


	Actively participate in and promote the project gate review process.
	Oversee vendor and logistics management, ensuring timely delivery of materials and services.
	Ensure data accuracy within NetSuite and other project management tools.
	Serve as a deputy for the Programme Manager as required and contribute to ad-hoc reporting.
	Actively participate in process improvement and automation initiatives.


Minimum Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent; a master’s degree is an added advantage) in a technical field or equivalent relevant experience.
	PMP, PRINCE2, or AGILE certification is a must-have.
	Proficient in Microsoft Project.
	Proficiency in English for understanding, speaking, and writing communications.


Experience & Skills:


	A minimum of 7 years of technical experience in the telecom industry, with at least 4 years in a project management role.
	Strong background in fiber network project management.
	Effective project management skills, including experience in written and verbal communication, as evidenced by work history and accomplishments.
	Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to summarize and present key information to stakeholders concisely.
	Proficiency in using BOSS tools and experience with the Microsoft Office suite, including MS Project.
	Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities and solve problems in a fast-paced environment.
	Familiarity with WIOCC network technologies, including Subsea, OTN, DWDM, SDH, and Data (Ethernet, IP/MPLS, OSPF, BGP), is preferred.
	Excellent interpersonal skills, including active listening, negotiation, and conflict resolution.
	Ability to work cross-functionally and influence teams in a matrix environment.


Attributes:


	Strong team leader and manager of virtual teams; motivated, persistent, and able to manage stress.
	Client-focused with confidence and relationship-building skills.
	Integrity and honesty with high ethical standards and strong negotiation skills.
	Passionate, adaptable, and flexible.
	Committed to personal excellence, accuracy, and attention to detail.
	Collaborative and results-driven through teamwork and partnerships.
	Strong analytical skills with the ability to collate and interpret data from various sources.
	Excellent communicator in both English, with a natural aptitude for dealing with people.
	Creative thinker with excellent problem-solving skills.
	Commercially aware, numerate, and articulate.
	Exceptional network diagnostic skills.
